Siswa di Kudus Bikin Pembungkus Makanan yang Bisa Dimakan
05 Nov 2019, 01:30 by Akrom Hazami - detikFood


Foto: iStock

Kudus - Saat ini penggunaan plastik di Indonesia sangat mengkhawatirkan. Mengingat butuh waktu ratusan tahun agar plastik bisa terurai sempurna.Beberapa kalangan telah melakukan pengurangan penggunaan plastik. Mulai dari sosialisasi bahan daur ulang, hingga berbagai produk ramah lingkungan. Satu di antaranya dilakukan oleh siswa Madrasah Aliyah Negeri (MAN) 1 Kabupaten Kudus dengan membuat edible film.Mereka adalah Azzalira Alayya Zahwa dan Fifi Munasaroh. Mereka membuat alat edible film. Lembaran film yang bisa dimakan atau dikonsumsi. Bahan film ini bisa digunakan untuk membungkus atau sebagai kemasan plastik pembungkus makanan. Keduanya dibimbing oleh tim guru pembimbing yakni Arif Nuradiayanto, Ahmad Edi Darmawan, Nurul Khotimah, dan Adi Tri Wibawa.


Foto: dok. detikFood/Akrom Hazami

Mantap! Ngopi Ditemani Getuk dan Udara Sejuk Bukit Muria



"Kami di penelitan kami membuat edible film. Yaitu lapisan tipis seperti plastik dari bahan alami, yang dapat dimakan, dan mudah terdegradasi oleh tanah," kata perwakilan salah satu dari mereka, Azzalira di Ruang Laboratorium Kimia, MAN 1, Jalan Conge, Bae, Kudus, Senin (4/11/2019).Dia menambahkan, edible film itu mereka buat dari bahan utama micro alga, spirulina plantesis, tepung mocaf, navicula SP, serasah daun mangrove dan lainnya. Bahan itu dicampur dan dilarutkan dalam aquades, kemudian dipanaskan dalam hotplate sambil diaduk manual hingga sekitar 15 menit."Setelah mencapai suhu 50 derajat-60 derajat, kita tambahkan bahan lainnya. Termasuk ada serasah daun mangrove. Di daun mangrove memiliki amilosa yang sangat tinggi," jelasnya lebih lanjut.


Foto: dok. detikFood/Akrom Hazami

"Kita dapat mangrove di hutan mangrove di Demak. Untuk pengembangan ke depannya, lebih melengkapi ujinya yakni uji anti bakteri, dan uji organo leptic untuk uji kelayakan dimakan," tambah Azzalira.Atas temuan ini, pihaknya berharap bisa dibantu pemerintah untuk bisa mengembangkan. "Yakni menggantikan plastik yang ada sekarang, dengan plastik kami yang lebih ramah lingkungan dan dapat dikembangkan lagi menjadi kantong plastik. sehingga lebih berguna di masyarakat," harapnya.Fifi Munasaroh, siswa lainnya menambahkan, manfaat dari edible film karya mereka adalah selain sebagai kemasan makanan, juga dapat mengurangi penggunaan sampah plastik di Indonesia. "Sebagai kemasan makanan dan mengurangi sampah plastik di Indonesia," jelas Fifi.Seorang guru MAN 1 Kudus, Agus berkesempatan mencoba makanan yang dibungkus edible film. Kebetulan makanan yang mereka siapkan adalah jenang. "Rasanya enak, seperti ada rumput lautnya. Makanan jenang rasanya lebih enak," kata Agus.


Foto: dok. detikFood/Akrom Hazami

Karya tersebut berhasil meraih peringkat kedua di kejuaraan tingkat nasional yang diadakan Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia (LIPI) di Indonesia Science Expo atau ISE 2019 pada 23-26 Oktober 2019 di Lomba Karya Ilmiah Remaja 2019 Bidang IPK."Kemarin ikut dalam lomba LKIR. Juara 2," tutup siswa Kelas XI MIPA 3.Kepala MAN 1 Kudus, Suhamto bangga dengan prestasi siswa. Sebab pihaknya memang mendorong anak didik terus berprestasi di setiap event. Seperti halnya yang diadakan oleh LIPI.

Students in Kudus Make Edible Food Wrappers
05 Nov 2019, 01:30 by Akrom Hazami - detikFood


Photo: iStock

Kudus - Currently the use of plastic in Indonesia is very worrying. Considering it takes hundreds of years for the plastic to decompose completely. Some circles have done a reduction in the use of plastic. Starting from the socialization of recycled materials, to various environmentally friendly products. One of them was conducted by Madrasah Aliyah Negeri 1 (MAN) students in Kudus Regency by making edible films. They were Azzalira Alayya Zahwa and Fifi Munasaroh. They make edible film tools. Film sheets which can be eaten or consumed. This film material can be used to wrap or as a plastic food packaging. Both were guided by a team of mentor teachers namely Arif Nuradiayanto, Ahmad Edi Darmawan, Nurul Khotimah, and Adi Tri Wibawa.


Photo: dock. detikFood / Akrom Hazami

"We in our research make edible film. That is a thin layer like plastic from natural materials, which can be eaten, and easily degraded by soil," said one of their representatives, Azzalira in the Chemistry Laboratory Room, MAN 1, Jalan Conge, Bae, Kudus, Monday (11/04/2019). He added that they made the edible film from the main ingredients of micro algae, spirulina plantesis, mocaf flour, SP navicula, mangrove leaf litter and others. The material is mixed and dissolved in distilled water, then heated in a hotplate while stirring manually for about 15 minutes. "After reaching a temperature of 50 degrees -60 degrees, we add other ingredients. Including there are mangrove leaf litter. Mangrove leaves have very high amylose, "he explained further.


Photo: dock. detikFood / Akrom Hazami

"We can mangroves in the mangrove forest in Demak. For future development, more complete testing is an anti-bacterial test, and organo leptic test for edibility," added Azzalira. Regarding these findings, he hoped the government could be helped to develop. "Namely replacing the existing plastic, with our plastic which is more environmentally friendly and can be developed again into a plastic bag. So it is more useful in the community," he hoped. Fifi Munasaroh, other students added, the benefits of their edible film were other than food packaging , can also reduce the use of plastic waste in Indonesia. "As food packaging and reducing plastic waste in Indonesia," explained Fifi. A MAN 1 Kudus teacher, Agus had the opportunity to try food wrapped in edible film. Incidentally the food they prepare is jenang. "It tastes good, like there is seaweed. Jenang food tastes better," Agus said.


Photo: dock. detikFood / Akrom Hazami

The work won second place in the national championship held by the Indonesian Institute of Sciences (LIPI) at the Indonesia Science Expo or ISE 2019 on October 23-26 2019 at the 2019 Youth Scientific Work Contest in the GPA. "Yesterday took part in the LKIR competition. Champion 2 , "closed students of Class XI MIPA 3. Head of MAN 1 Kudus, Suhamto was proud of the students' achievements. Because it really encourages students to continue to excel in every event. As is the case with LIPI.
